snippet: Faulty intelligence conclusions about Saddam Hussein’s supposed weapons of mass destruction have cast a shadow over current efforts to evaluate Iran’s nuclear capabilities.
abstract: Central Intelligence Agency's faulty conclusions about Saddam Hussein’s supposed weapons of mass destruction cast shadow over its current efforts to evaluate Iran’s nuclear capabilities; analysts are now forced to be more skeptical in evaluating evidence and more cautious in drawing conclusions; former intelligence officials say that this is appropriate vigilance, while some detractors argue that the agency is being overly skittish on Iran, reluctant to be blamed for any findings that might lead to American bloodshed.
lead_paragraph: Faulty intelligence conclusions about Saddam Hussein’s supposed weapons of mass destruction have cast a shadow over current efforts to evaluate Iran’s nuclear capabilities.

headline.seo: Assessing Iran, but Thinking About Iraq
headline.main: Ghosts of Iraq Haunting C.I.A. in Tackling Iran
headline.print_headline: Ghosts of Iraq Haunting C.I.A. In Tackling Iran

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
